card.name: Bishop
card.property: Energy Absorption — Response: After Bishop takes any amount of damage from an attack, discard an equal number of cards from the top of your deck. Add each resource card discarded this way to your hand.

alternate.name: Lucas Bishop
alternate.property: Temporally Displaced — Response: After you change to this form, add a [[TEMPORAL]] card in your discard pile to your hand.
"When I journeyed to the past to save my future, this was not what I had in mind."

card.name: Malcolm
card.property: Action: Discard a resource card from your hand → ready Malcolm. If that card has a printed [physical] icon, heal 1 damage from Malcolm. (Limit once per phase.)
"Multiple contacts. Engaging."

card.name: Randall
card.property: Action: Discard a resource card from your hand → ready Randall. If that card has a printed [energy] icon, heal 1 damage from Randall. (Limit once per phase.)
"We're with you, boss. All the way."

card.name: Bishop's Rifle
card.property: Restricted. Hero Action (attack): Exhaust Bishop's Rifle and choose an enemy → deal 1 damage to that enemy for each resource card in your hand. This attack gains ranged.

card.name: Bishop's Uniform
card.property: Response: After you resolve Bishop's "Energy Absorption" ability, exhaust Bishop's Uniform → heal 1 damage from Bishop for each resource card in your hand.

card.name: Super-Charged
card.property: Action: Discard a resource card from your hand → place 1 charge counter here for each resource icon on that card. Hero Interrupt: When you make a basic attack, discard Super-Charged → you get +2 ATK for this attack for each charge counter here (to a maximum of +8 ATK).

card.name: Concussive Blast
card.property: Hero Action (attack): Deal 6 damage to an enemy. If you paid for this event with a resource card, ready Bishop.
Bishop's power allows him to absorb energy and rechannel it into powerful blasts.

card.name: Command Authority
card.property: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 3 threat from a scheme. If you paid for this event with a resource card, draw 1 card.
"Everyone, on me!" —Bishop

card.name: Energy Conversion
card.property: Hero Interrupt (defense): When an enemy attacks, shuffle each resource card in your discard pile into your deck. You cannot take more than 3 damage from this attack.

card.name: Stored Energy
card.property: "The more you hit me, the harder I hit back!" —Bishop

card.name: Cable
card.property: Response: After Cable thwarts and defeats a side scheme, draw 1 card.
"I know too much about what the future holds."

card.name: X-23
card.property: Response: After X-23 attacks and defeats an enemy, ready her.
"Call me 'Lady-Wolverine' one more time - I dare you!"

card.name: Team Training
card.property: Play under any player's control. Max 1 per player. Each ally you control gets +1 hit point.

card.name: Advanced Suit
card.property: Attach to an [[X-FORCE]] or [[X-MEN]] ally. Max 1 per ally. Response: After attached ally defeats a minion or side scheme, discard 1 card from your hand → heal 1 damage from attached ally for each resource on that card.

card.name: Sidekick
card.property: Attach to an identity-specific ally you control. Max 1 per deck. Attached ally gets +2 hit points and is your "sidekick." Response: After you make a basic recovery, heal 2 damage from attached ally.

card.name: Side-by-Side
card.property: Hero Action: Ready your sidekick → ready your hero and choose one: • Heal 1 damage from both characters. • Both characters get +1 THW and +1 ATK until the end of the phase.

card.name: Suit Up
card.property: Alter-Ego Action: Search your deck and discard pile for an ally and an upgrade that can be attached to that ally. Add them to your hand. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Lead from the Front
card.property: Hero Action: Choose a player. Each character that player controls gets +1 THW and +1 ATK until the end of the phase.

card.name: The Power of Leadership
card.property: Max 2 per deck. Double the number of resources this card generates while paying for a Leadership (blue) card.

card.name: Legion
card.property: [star] Response: After Legion uses a basic power, discard the top card of your deck. If that card's printed resource has: [energy] — Deal 2 damage to an enemy. [mental] — Remove 2 threat from a scheme. [physical] — Heal 2 damage from Legion.

card.name: Marrow
card.property: Play only if you have the [[X-FORCE]] or [[X-MEN]] trait. Response: After Marrow enters play, deal 2 damage to an enemy.
"You won't look so pretty once I get you!"

card.name: Magik
card.property: Play with the top card of your deck faceup. Once per phase, you may play the top card of your deck as if it was in your hand, reducing its resource cost by 1.
"There are no snowflakes in Limbo."

alternate.name: Illyana Rasputin
alternate.property: Interrupt: When you change to hero form, choose a [[SPELL]] in your discard pile and put it on top of your deck. (Limit once per phase.)
"I would sell the last piece of my soul for an egg roll right now!"

card.name: Colossus
card.property: Toughness. Interrupt: When an enemy attacks you, play Colossus from your hand (paying his resource cost) and declare him the defender without exhausting him.
"I will always protect you, little Snowflake."

card.name: Limbo
card.property: Response: After the villain phase begins, exhaust Limbo → swap a card in your hand with the top card of your deck. Action: Exhaust Limbo → swap a card in your hand with the top card of your deck.

card.name: Magik's Crown
card.property: Magik gains steady. While the top card of your deck has a [mental] or [wild] resource icon, Magik gets +1 THW.
Raised in Limbo, Magik is destined to usurp its rule from the man who brought her there.

card.name: Soulsword
card.property: Restricted. Magik's basic attacks gain piercing. While the top card of your deck has a [physical] or [wild] resource icon, Magik gets +1 ATK.

card.name: Mystical Armor
card.property: Magik gains retaliate 1. While the top card of your deck has a [energy] or [wild] resource icon, Magik gets +1 DEF.
It's very fashionable in Limbo.

card.name: Scrying
card.property: Action: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw one, discard one, and put one back on top of your deck.
"Yes, I've seen your future. No, I will not tell you."—Magik

card.name: Stepping Disc
card.property: Hero Action: Ready your hero. Choose a Magik card in your discard pile not named Stepping Disc and put it on top of your deck.
Magik's teleportation discs can take her anywhere by opening a portal through Limbo.

card.name: Exorcism
card.property: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 4 threat from a scheme. If the top card of your deck has a [mental] or [wild] resource icon, confuse the villain.
"I have purged the evil from within you." —Magik

card.name: Soul Strike
card.property: Hero Action (attack): Deal 4 damage to an enemy. If the top card of your deck has a [physical] or [wild] resource icon, stun that enemy.
"Very well. Feel the bite of my Soulsword!" —Magik

card.name: Magic Barrier
card.property: Hero Interrupt (defense): When an enemy initiates an attack, prevent 3 damage from this attack. If the top card of your deck has a [energy] or [wild] resource icon, deal 3 damage to the attacking enemy.

card.name: Goldballs
card.property: [star] Interrupt: When Goldballs attacks, discard up to 3 cards from the top of your deck → Goldballs gets +X ATK for this attack, where X is the number of cards discarded this way.
"I didn't choose the name."

card.name: Tempus
card.property: Play only if your identity has the [[X-MEN]] trait. Interrupt: When the villain would scheme, discard Tempus → cancel that activation. Deal yourself 1 facedown encounter card.

card.name: Blood Rage
card.property: Max 1 per player. Response: After you defeat an enemy with a basic attack, exhaust Blood Rage and take 1 damage → draw 1 card.

card.name: Test the Defense
card.property: Max 1 per player. Response: After you play an [[ATTACK]] event, place 1 test counter here. If there are 5 test counters here, discard this card to deal 5 damage to an enemy.

card.name: Full-Body Charge
card.property: Hero Action (attack): Deal 8 damage to an enemy. If your hero's remaining hit points are less than half your hero's starting hit points, this attack gains overkill.
"Coming through, tovarisch!"—Colossus

card.name: Clobber
card.property: Hero Action (Attack): Deal 3 damage to an enemy. If this is the first card you have played this round, return this card to your hand.

card.name: The Power of Aggression
card.property: Max 2 per deck. Double the number of resources this card generates while paying for a Aggression (red) card.

card.name: Triage
card.property: Response: After Triage enters play, heal 2 damage from an [[X-Men]] character.
"Let me have a look at that."

card.name: Stepford Cuckoos
card.property: Play only if your identity has the [[X-Men]] trait. Uses (3 psi counters). Interrupt: When a player reveals a treachery, exhaust Stepford Cuckoos and remove 1 psi counter here → cancel the effects of that card and discard it. That player reveals another encounter card.

card.name: Bloodgem
card.property: Play only if your identity has the [[MYSTIC]] trait. Max 1 per deck. Resource: Exhaust Bloodgem and take 2 damage → generate a [wild] resource.

card.name: Basic Spell
card.property: Play only if your identity has the [[MYSTIC]] trait. Hero Action: Choose one: • Heal 3 damage from an identity. • Remove 3 threat from a scheme. • Deal 3 damage to an enemy.

card.name: Spiritual Meditation
card.property: Play only if your identity has the [[Mystic]] trait. Action: Draw 2 cards. Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

card.name: Mission Team
card.property: Mission Team cannot be discarded and the first player gains control of it. Action: Exhaust Mission Team → choose: • Reduce the cost of the next ally played to the mission by 2. • Make a mission attempt.

alternate.name: Mission Team
alternate.property: Mission Team cannot be discarded and the first player gains control of it. Action: Exhaust Mission Team → choose a player to draw 1 card.
"Another successful mission. Hopefully this time they don't sue for damages!" —Polaris

card.name: Destiny
card.property: Response: After Destiny enters your hand, remove 2 threat from the main scheme.
"Outsmarting your opponent is child's play when you know the future."

card.name: Blink
card.property: Response: After Blink enters your hand, deal 2 damage to the villain.
"My name's Blink. Who do you think is faster?"

card.name: Morph
card.property: Response: After Morph enters your hand, confuse the villain.
"What's all the hubbub, bub?"

card.name: X-Man
card.property: Response: After X-Man enters your hand, give your identity a tough status card.
"The innocent are safe so long as I have anything to say!"

card.name: Desperate Measures
card.property: Attach to an ally. Limit 1 per ally. Attached ally gets +1 THW, +1 ATK, +1 hit point, and is considered to have a wild ([wild]) resource icon in addition to its printed resource icon.
"My brother will never stop." —Magik

card.name: Fear the Future
card.property: Give to the Lucas Bishop player. You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose: • Exhaust Lucas Bishop → remove Fear the Future from the game. • Discard this card and each resource card from your hand. If no resource cards are discarded this way, this card gains surge.

card.name: Trevor Fitzroy
card.property: Quickstrike. Forced Response: After Trevor Fitzroy attacks and defeats an ally, if Portal Through Time is in play, place 2 threat on it. Otherwise, find it and reveal it. (Bishop's nemesis minion.)

card.name: Portal Through Time
card.property: Forced Interrupt: When a [[Temporal]] card is revealed, it gains surge. (Limit once per phase.)
Trevor Fitzroy uses his time portals to commit crimes and escape justice.

card.name: Bantam
card.property: When Revealed: If Portal Through Time is in play, place 2 threat on it. Otherwise, find Portal Through Time and reveal it.
"Time to go, Trevor."

card.name: Temporal Trickery
card.property: When Revealed: Discard a card in your hand with the most printed resource icons. Place 1 threat on each scheme for each resource icon on that card.
"That's why I love time travel no matter how many times I rob this bank, they're always surprised." —Trevor Fitzroy

card.name: Darkchilde
card.property: Give to the Illyana Rasputin player. You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose: • Exhaust Illyana Rasputin → remove Darkchilde from the game. • Deal 1 damage to each character you control. Discard this obligation.

card.name: Belasco
card.property: Villainous. [star] Forced Response: After Belasco activates against you, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If Ruler of Limbo is in play, attach those cards to it facedown. (Magik's nemesis minion.)

card.name: Ruler of Limbo
card.property: Threat cannot be removed from this scheme while Belasco is in play. When Revealed: The Illyana Rasputin player finds Limbo and attaches it facedown here. When this scheme is defeated, put Limbo into play under its owner's control.

card.name: S'ym
card.property: Guard. When Revealed: If Ruler of Limbo is in play, place 2 threat on it. Otherwise, place 2 threat on the main scheme.
"The boss says he's had enough of your constant meddling."

card.name: Witchfire
card.property: Quickstrike. Forced Response: After Witchfire attacks and defeats an ally, place 1 threat on Ruler of Limbo. Otherwise, place 1 threat on the main scheme.
"Limbo is my birthright!"

card.name: Battle for Limbo
card.property:
When Revealed: Each [[Limbo]] minion in play activates against the player it is engaged with. If no [[Limbo]] minion activated this way, this card gains surge.
[star] Boost: If Ruler of Limbo is in play, place 2 threat on it.

card.name: Unus
card.property: Toughness. If the amount of threat on Gene Pool is at least: • 3 — Unus gains retaliate 1. • 6 — Unus also gains stalwart. • 9 — Unus also gains a [amplify] icon.

card.name: Unus
card.property: Toughness. If the amount of threat on Gene Pool is at least: • 3 — Unus gains retaliate 1. • 6 — Unus also gains stalwart. • 9 — Unus also gains a [amplify] icon.

card.name: Unus
card.property: Toughness. If the amount of threat on Gene Pool is at least: • 3 — Unus gains retaliate 1. • 6 — Unus also gains stalwart. • 9 — Unus also gains a [amplify] icon.

card.name: Hunting Gene Traitors
card.property: Contents: Unus (I) and Unus (II). (Unus (II) and Unus (III) instead for expert mode.) Unus, Infinites, and Standard sets. One modular set (Dystopian Nightmare). Setup: Reveal the Gene Pool side scheme. In expert mode, deal each player a facedown encounter card.

alternate.name: Hunting Gene Traitors
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, place 1 threat on Gene Pool. If this scheme is completed, the players lose the game.
Prelate Unus and his squad of Infinites scour the ruins of the X-Mansion for the enemies of Apocalypse.

card.name: Prelate Sidearm
card.property: Attach to Unus. [star] Forced Response: After Unus attacks and defeats an ally, place 1 threat on Gene Pool. Hero Response: After you make a basic attack against Unus, spend [energy] [physical] resources → discard this card.

card.name: Prelate Armor
card.property: Attach to Unus. [star] Forced Response: After Unus schemes, give him a tough status card. Hero Response: After you make a basic attack against Unus, spend [mental] [physical] resources → discard this card.

card.name: Infinite Hunter
card.property:
When Revealed: Deal 3 damage to an ally you control.
[star] Boost: Choose to either place 2 threat on Gene Pool, or the activating enemy gets +2 SCH and +2 ATK for this activation.

card.name: Genetic Experiments
card.property:
Attach to an [[Infinite]] minion. Otherwise, this card gains surge. Attached minion gets +2 hit points. Forced Interrupt: When attached minion is defeated, place 2 threat on Gene Pool.
[star] Boost: Attach this card to an [[Infinite]] minion.

card.name: Infinite Prelate
card.property: When Revealed: Unus activates against you. If the amount of threat on Gene Pool is at least: • 3 — Give Unus a tough status card. • 6 — Heal 3 damage from Unus as well. • 9 — Give Unus an additional boost card for this activation as well.

card.name: Endless Ranks
card.property: When Defeated: Place 3 threat on Gene Pool.
The Infinites live up to their name: no matter how many you defeat, they keep making more.

card.name: Infinite Soldier
card.property: Guard. If the amount of threat on Gene Pool is at least: • 3 — This minion gains quickstrike. • 6 — This minion also gains surge. • 9 — This minion also gets +3 hit points.

card.name: Culling the Weak
card.property:
When Revealed: Place 4 threat on Gene Pool.
[star] Boost: Place 2 threat on Gene Pool.
The Infinites were created to enforce the mandate of Apocalypse: the weak must perish.

card.name: Gene Pool
card.property: Permanent. Setup. Forced Response: After an ally is defeated by anything other than consequential damage, place 3 threat here.
Apocalypse uses the raw genetic material of his victims to create the Infinites.

card.name: Hunted
card.property: Alter-Ego Action: Discard a card from your hand → discard this card.

card.name: War-Weary
card.property:
When Revealed: You are stunned. If you were already stunned, take 2 damage instead.
[star] Boost: You are stunned. If you were already stunned, take 2 damage instead.

card.name: Targeted for Extermination
card.property: When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme confuses their identity.
The Infinites hunt down those whom their master deems unworthy.

card.name: Pursued by the Past
card.property: Permanent. Setup. Forced Response: After you place a pursuit counter here, if the number of counters here is at least 3 more than the number of players, remove each counter here → if your nemesis minion is in play, it activates against you. Otherwise, flip this card over.

alternate.name: Pursued by the Past
alternate.property: Permanent. Forced Response: After you flip to this side, find your nemesis minion and reveal it. Search the set-aside area for your nemesis side scheme and reveal it. Shuffle your remaining set-aside nemesis set into the encounter deck. Flip this card over.

card.name: Dark Design
card.property: When Revealed: Place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past. Then, if it has any counters on it, the villain schemes. [star] Boost: After this activation resolves, place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past.

card.name: Sinister Strike
card.property: When Revealed (Alter-Ego): Place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past. Then, if it has any counters on it, this card gains surge. When Revealed (Hero): Place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past. Then, if it has any counters on it, the villain attacks you.

card.name: Evil Alliance
card.property: When Revealed: Each nemesis minion in play activates against you. If no minions activated this way, place 3 pursuit counters on Pursued by the Past. [star] Boost: After this activation resolves, place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past.

card.name: Nowhere is Safe
card.property:
When Revealed: Place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past. Then, if it has any counters on it, discard an upgrade or support you control.
[star] Boost: After this activation resolves, place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past.

card.name: Drawing Near
card.property: Forced Response: After your turn begins, discard the top card of your deck. Place 1 pursuit counter on Pursued by the Past for each printed resource icon on that card. Alter-Ego Action: Discard an identity-specific card from your hand → discard this card.

card.name: War
card.property: [star] Forced Response: After War attacks you, if he has at least 1 hit point, discard an upgrade or support you control. War cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

alternate.name: War
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After War attacks you, if he has at least 1 hit point, discard an upgrade or support you control. War cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

card.name: Famine
card.property: [star] Forced Response: After Famine attacks you, if she has at least 1 hit point, discard the top 10 cards of your deck. Famine cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

alternate.name: Famine
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After Famine attacks you, if she has at least 1 hit point, discard the top 10 cards of your deck. Famine cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

card.name: Pestilence
card.property: [star] Forced Response: After Pestilence attacks you, if she has at least 1 hit point, treat your identity's text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]) until the next villain phase begins. Pestilence cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

alternate.name: Pestilence
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After Pestilence attacks you, if she has at least 1 hit point, treat your identity's text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]) until the next villain phase begins. Pestilence cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

card.name: Death
card.property: [star] Forced Response: After Death attacks you, if he has at least 1 hit point, deal 1 damage to each character you control. Death cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

alternate.name: Death
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After Death attacks you, if he has at least 1 hit point, deal 1 damage to each character you control. Death cannot be defeated while another villain has at least 1 hit point.

card.name: The Horsemen of Apocalypse
card.property: Contents: War (A), Famine (A), Pestilence (A), Death (A), Four Horsemen, Standard, and two modular sets (Dystopian Nightmare and Hounds) . Setup: Shuffle the four [[Horsemen]] villains, then reveal them in a row from left to right. Place the active counter on the leftmost villain (see rulebook). Each player reveals a random side scheme from the Four Horsemen encounter set.

alternate.name: The Horsemen of Apocalypse
alternate.property: Forced Response: After a villain activates, move the active counter to the next villain. If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.
The Four Horsemen are the most brutal servants of Apocalypse. They strike in turn, using their powers as a team.

card.name: The Ravages of War
card.property: When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme discards an upgrade or support they control.
War uses the shockwaves created by his arms to keep his opponents off balance.

card.name: A Time of Famine
card.property: When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme discards the top 10 cards of their deck.
The mere touch of Famine leaves even the strongest mutant enfeebled.

card.name: Plague and Pestilence
card.property: When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme treats their identity's text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]) until the next villain phase begins.
Pestilence uses her power to make her enemies sick and helpless.

card.name: The Specter of Death
card.property: When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme deals 1 damage to each character they control.
The shadow of Death drives fear into the hearts of those he hunts.

card.name: Golden Horse
card.property: Attach to the villain with the fewest hit points without the [[Aerial]] trait. Attached villain gains the [[Aerial]] trait and is considered to have at least 1 hit point. Hero Response: After you attack attached villain, resolve its "Forced Response" as if it just attacked you → discard this card.

card.name: Metal Wings
card.property: Attach to Death and move the active counter to him. Death gains retaliate 1 and is considered to have at least 1 hit point remaining. Hero Response: After you attack Death, resolve his "Forced Response" as if he just attacked you → discard this card.

card.name: Horseman of War
card.property:
When Revealed: Heal 2 damage from War and give him a tough status card. He activates against you.
[star] Boost: After this activation, War activates against you. Do not give War a boost card for that activation.

card.name: Horseman of Famine
card.property:
When Revealed: Heal 2 damage from Famine and give her a tough status card. She activates against you.
[star] Boost: After this activation, Famine activates against you. Do not give Famine a boost card for that activation.

card.name: Horseman of Pestilence
card.property:
When Revealed: Heal 2 damage from Pestilence and give her a tough status card. She activates against you.
[star] Boost: After this activation, Pestilence activates against you. Do not give Pestilence a boost card for that activation.

card.name: Horseman of Death
card.property:
When Revealed: Heal 2 damage from Death and give him a tough status card. He activates against you.
[star] Boost: After this activation, Death activates against you. Do not give Death a boost card for that activation.

card.name: Rough Riders
card.property: When Revealed: Resolve the "Forced Response" on the active villain as if it has at least 1 hit point and attacked you. Move the active counter to the next villain and resolve its "Forced Response" the same way.

card.name: Ahab
card.property: Toughness. When Revealed: If Release the Hounds is in play, place 3 threat on it. Otherwise, find the Release the Hounds side scheme and reveal it.
"You cannot hide from me, mutant."

card.name: Hound
card.property: Guard. When Revealed: If you are in hero form, Hound attacks you. Otherwise, change your identity to hero form.
Ahab's hounds are mutants stripped of free will and forced to hunt their own kind.

card.name: Ahab's Energy Spear
card.property: Attach to Ahab. Otherwise, attach to the villain. [star] Forced Interrupt: When attached enemy attacks you, this attack gains overkill and piercing. At the end of this attack, discard Ahab's Energy Spear.

card.name: Release the Hounds
card.property: The first copy of Hound revealed each phase gains surge. When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Hound and deals it to themself as a facedown encounter card.
Ahab takes pleasure in hunting mutants with the help of his hounds.

card.name: Apocalypse
card.property: Toughness. Forced Interrupt: When the main scheme is completed, remove all threat from it (ignoring any crisis ([crisis]) icons). Flip this card and reveal Apocalypse (II).
"Challenge me and be reminded why Apocalypse reigns supreme."

alternate.name: Apocalypse
alternate.property: Steady. Toughness. Forced Interrupt: When the main scheme is completed, remove all threat from it (ignoring any crisis ([crisis]) icons). Remove this card from the game and reveal Apocalypse (III).
"You are foolish to oppose me."

card.name: Apocalypse
card.property: Steady. Toughness. Forced Interrupt: When the main scheme is completed, remove all threat from it (ignoring any crisis ([crisis]) icons). Flip this card and reveal Apocalypse (IV).
"This world belongs to me and those I deem worthy."

alternate.name: Apocalypse
alternate.property: Stalwart. Toughness. [star] Apocalypse's attacks gain overkill. Forced Interrupt: When the main scheme is completed, the players lose the game.
"I will cleanse this world with fire. Only the strong will survive."

card.name: The Age of Apocalypse
card.property: Contents: Apocalypse (II) and Apocalypse (III). (Apocalypse (III) only for expert mode.) Apocalypse, Prelates, and Standard sets. Two modular sets (Dark Riders and Infinites). Setup: Set aside each unused villain card, each [[Prelate]] minion, and The Tyrant's Throne side scheme. Reveal the Heart of the Empire side scheme. The first player reveals a random, set-aside [[Prelate]] minion.

alternate.name: The Age of Apocalypse
alternate.property: X is the numeral in Apocalypse's printed hit point value. Forced Interrupt: When Apocalypse would be defeated, discard each attachment from him and heal all damage from him instead. Remove X threat from this scheme (ignoring any crisis ([crisis]) icons).
The time has come for a direct assault on Apocalypse in his towering citadel.

card.name: Heart of the Empire
card.property: Threat cannot be removed from this scheme while a [[Prelate]] minion is in play. When Defeated: The first player reveals a random set-aside [[Prelate]] minion. Deal each other player an encounter card. Flip this card over.
Before you can challenge Apocalypse, you must fight your way through his tower.

alternate.name: The Towering Citadel
alternate.property: Threat cannot be removed from this scheme while a [[Prelate]] minion is in play. When Defeated: The first player reveals a random set-aside [[Prelate]] minion. Deal each other player an encounter card. Reveal The Tyrant's Throne side scheme and remove this card from the game.

card.name: The Tyrant's Throne
card.property: Threat cannot be removed from this scheme while a [[Prelate]] minion is in play. When Defeated: The first player reveals a random set-aside [[Prelate]] minion. Deal each other player an encounter card. Flip this card over and reveal No Longer Worthy.

alternate.name: No Longer Worthy
alternate.property: Attach to Apocalypse and heal 5[per_hero] hit points from him. He cannot take damage while a [[Prelate]] minion is in play. Ignore the "Forced Interrupt" on the main scheme. Forced Interrupt: When Apocalypse is defeated, the players win the game.

card.name: Cyberpathy
card.property:
Attach to Apocalypse. [star] Forced Response: After Apocalypse schemes, place 1 threat on each side scheme.
[star] Boost: Attach this card to Apocalypse.

card.name: Biomorphing
card.property:
Attach to Apocalypse. [star] Apocalypse's attacks gain overkill.
[star] Boost: Attach this card to Apocalypse.

card.name: Molecular Control
card.property:
Attach to Apocalypse. Apocalypse gains retaliate 1 and stalwart.
[star] Boost: Attach this card to Apocalypse.
Apocalypse's power to control every molecule in his body makes him an unpredictable foe.

card.name: The Fittest
card.property: Attach to the minion with the highest printed hit points and give it a tough status card. Otherwise, this card gains surge. Attached enemy gets +5 hit points.
Apocalypse promotes only the strongest and most ruthless mutants to the rank of Prelate.

card.name: Wolf Among Sheep
card.property:
When Revealed: The [[Prelate]] minion activates against you. Otherwise, Apocalypse activates against you.
[star] Boost: Give the [[Prelate]] minion a tough status card. Otherwise, give Apocalypse a tough status card.

card.name: The Apocalypse Solution
card.property: When Defeated: Discard the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is the numeral in Apocalypse's printed hit point value.
Apocalypse would rather burn his kingdom to the ground than surrender his rule.

card.name: Gauntlet
card.property: Teamwork ([[Dark Riders]]). [star] Forced Response: After Gauntlet attacks you, discard an upgrade you control.
"You want someone gone? You hire the Dark Riders."

card.name: Barrage
card.property: Teamwork ([[Dark Riders]]). [star] Forced Response: After Barrage attacks you, deal 1 damage to each character you control.
"Don't expect someone named 'Barrage' to be picky with their targets." —Cyclops

card.name: Hard-Drive
card.property: Teamwork ([[Dark Riders]]). [star] Forced Response: After Hard-Drive attacks you, place 1 threat on each scheme.
"I've finished my scan. Ready to jump."

card.name: Tusk
card.property:
Teamwork ([[Dark Riders]]). [star] Forced Response: After Tusk attacks you, you are stunned.
[star] Boost: You are stunned.

card.name: Psynapse
card.property:
Teamwork ([[Dark Riders]]). [star] Forced Response: After Psynapse attacks you, you are confused.
[star] Boost: You are confused.

card.name: The Dark Riders
card.property: Hinder 1[per_hero]. Each [[Dark Riders]] minion gains toughness. When Revealed: Discard cards from the encounter deck until a [[Dark Riders]] minion is discarded and reveal it.
Dark Riders live by the axiom: The weak must perish.

card.name: Dark Beast
card.property: [star] Forced Interrupt: When Dark Beast attacks you, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment. When Revealed: Reveal a random set-aside environment and shuffle the rest of its encounter set into the encounter deck.
"A villain's work is never done!"

card.name: Dark Beast
card.property: [star] Forced Interrupt: When Dark Beast attacks you, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment. When Revealed: Reveal a random set-aside environment and shuffle the rest of its encounter set into the encounter deck. Deal each player an encounter card.

card.name: Dark Beast
card.property: [star] Forced Interrupt: When Dark Beast attacks you, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment. When Revealed: Reveal a random set-aside environment and shuffle the rest of its encounter set into the encounter deck. Deal each player an encounter card.

card.name: Dark Beast's Bogus Journey
card.property: Contents: Dark Beast (I) and Dark Beast (II). (Dark Beast (II) and Dark Beast (III) for expert mode.) Dark Beast, Blue Moon, Genosha, Savage Land, and Standard sets. One modular set (Dystopian Nightmare). Setup: Set the Blue Moon, Genosha, and Savage Land sets aside (including each environment card in those sets). In expert mode, reveal the High-Tech Goggles attachment.

alternate.name: Dark Beast's Bogus Journey
alternate.property: If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.

Dark Beast activates his time machine to ensure the rise of Apocalypse, but your quick action ruins his calculations. You wrestle for control of the device as it transports you through time and space!

card.name: High-Tech Goggles
card.property:
Attach to Dark Beast. Hero Action: Exhaust your hero and resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment. → discard this card.
[star] Boost: Attach this card to Dark Beast.

card.name: Genetic Enhancement
card.property:
Attach to Dark Beast. Hero Action: Exhaust your hero and resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment. → discard this card.
[star] Boost: Attach this card to Dark Beast.

card.name: Cruel Experiment
card.property: Attached minion gets +2 hit points and gains guard. When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until you discard a minion. Reveal that minion and attach Cruel Experiment to it.
"I could do this with anesthesia, but what fun would that be?" —Dark Beast

card.name: Evil Genius
card.property: When Revealed (Alter-Ego): Dark Beast schemes. Give him a tough status card. When Revealed (Hero): Dark Beast attacks you. Give him an additional boost card for this attacks.

card.name: Time-Travel Shenanigans
card.property: When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until they discard a card from the same encounter set as the [[Setting]] environment and reveals the just-discarded card.

card.name: The Savage Land
card.property: Setup. The villain gains retaliate 1. Special: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. When Revealed: Discard each other [[Setting]] environment in play.

card.name: Pterosaur
card.property:
When Revealed: Resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.
[star] Boost: If The Savage Land is in play, deal Pterosaur to yourself as a facedown encounter card.

card.name: Velociraptor
card.property: Quickstrike. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Velociraptor attacks you, discard the top card of your deck. Velociraptor gets +1 ATK for this attack for each resource icon discarded this way.

card.name: Giant Ape
card.property: Guard. When Defeated: The player who defeated Giant Ape resolves the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.
"This is why you don't feed the animals!" —Jubilee

card.name: Land Out of Time
card.property: When Revealed: If the Savage Land is in play, resolve its "Special" ability and take 1 indirect damage for each resource icon on the discarded cards. Otherwise, find The Savage Land and reveal it.
The Savage Land is exactly what you'd expect from a prehistoric jungle in the middle of Antarctica.

card.name: Village Under Attack
card.property: Hinder 1[per_hero]. When Defeated: Each player resolves the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.
"We need ta save the village from those dinosaurs! (is something Ah never imagined saying.)" —Rogue

card.name: Genosha
card.property: Setup. The villain gains steady. Special: Place 1 threat on the main scheme. When Revealed: Discard each other [[Setting]] environment in play.

card.name: Magistrate
card.property:
Patrol. When Defeated: The defeating player finds Escaped Mutant and attaches it to their identity.
[star] Boost: If Escaped Mutant is attached to your identity, this card gains [boost][boost][boost].

card.name: Armored Unibike
card.property: Armored Unibike engages the player with Escaped Mutant attached, if able. [star] Forced Response: After Armored Unibike attacks, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.
"I have the mutant's signal. Moving to intercept."

card.name: Genoshan Mech
card.property: Guard. Toughness. [star] Forced Response: After Genoshan Mech attacks and defeats one of your allies, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment twice.
"Their suits are built to counter our powers." —Storm

card.name: Escaped Mutant
card.property: Attach to your identity. Each [[Genosha]] minion that engages you gains quickstrike. Alter-Ego Action: Resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment → discard this card.
Mutants who wish to escape Genosha must find a way to evade the magistrate.

card.name: Police State
card.property: Hinder 1[per_hero]. When Defeated: The player who defeated this scheme finds the Escaped Mutant attachment and reveals it.
Genosha built its wealth by exploiting its mutant population.

card.name: Blue Area of the Moon
card.property: Setup. Each minion gains guard. Special: Deal 1 damage to your identity. When Revealed: Discard each other [[Setting]] environment in play.

card.name: Gladiator
card.property:
Teamwork ([[Imperial Guard]]). While Trial by Combat is in play, Gladiator cannot take damage.
[star] Boost: If Trial by Combat is in play, deal Gladiator by yourself as a facedown encounter card.

card.name: Oracle
card.property: Teamwork ([[Imperial Guard]]). When Revealed: You are confused. If you were already confused, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.
"This is not a fight you can win."

card.name: Manta
card.property: Teamwork ([[Imperial Guard]]). When Revealed: You are stunned. If you were already stunned, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.

card.name: Earthquake
card.property: Teamwork ([[Imperial Guard]]). When Revealed: Exhaust your identity. If you were already exhausted, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.
"Let me shake things up!"

card.name: Warstar
card.property: Teamwork ([[Imperial Guard]]). When Revealed: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an [[Imperial Guard]] minion, reveal it. Otherwise, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.

card.name: Imperial Guardsman
card.property: Attach to a minion. Otherwise, this card gains surge. Attached minion gets +4 hit points and gains the [[Imperial Guard]] trait. Forced Interrupt: When attached minion is defeated, resolve the "Special" ability on the [[Setting]] environment.

card.name: Trial by Combat
card.property: Hinder 1[per_hero]. When Defeated: Shuffle each [[Imperial Guard]] minion in the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Shi'ar law grants the accused an opportunity to defend themselves, but they must battle the Imperial Guard.

card.name: En Sabah Nur's Pyramid
card.property: Contents: Apocalypse (I) and Apocalypse (II). (Apocalypse (II) and Apocalypse (III) for expert mode.) En Sabah Nur and Standard sets. Two modular sets (Celestial Tech and Clan Akkaba). Setup: Apocalypse begins the game in [[Biomorph]] form. Deal each player a facedown encounter card.

alternate.name: En Sabah Nur's Pyramid
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After resolving step 1 of the villain phase, place 1 power counter here. If there are at least 4 power counters here, the first player removes 4 of them and discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Superpower]] card is discarded and reveal it.
Within his high-tech pyramid, Apocalypse prepares for his ascension.

card.name: The Rise of Apocalypse
card.property: When Revealed: The first player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Superpower]] card is discarded and reveals it.
You've seen what the future looks like if Apocalypse's influence is allowed to grow. It's up to you to stop the megalomaniac here and now!

alternate.name: The Rise of Apocalypse
alternate.property: [star] Forced Response: After resolving step 1 of the villain phase, place 1 power counter here. If there are at least 4 power counters here, the first player removes 4 of them and discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Superpower]] card is discarded and reveals it. If this scheme is completed, the players lose the game.

card.name: Staggering Strength
card.property:
Attach to Apocalypse and change him to [[Giant]] form. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Apocalypse attacks you, you are stunned. Discard this card after this activation.
[star] Boost: After this activation, reveal this card.

card.name: Biomorphic Blast
card.property:
When Revealed: If Apocalypse is in [[Biomorph]] form, he activates against you. Otherwise, change Apocalypse to [[Biomorph]] form and place 1 power counter on the main scheme.
[star] Boost: After this activation, change Apocalypse to [[Biomorph]] form.

card.name: Technological Interface
card.property:
When Revealed: If Apocalypse is in [[Cyberpath]] form, he activates against you. Otherwise, change Apocalypse to [[Cyberpath]] form and place 1 power counter on the main scheme.
[star] Boost: After this activation, change Apocalypse to [[Cyberpath]] form.

card.name: Giant-Sized Despot
card.property:
When Revealed: If Apocalypse is in [[Giant]] form, he activates against you. Otherwise, change Apocalypse to [[Giant]] form and place 1 power counter on the main scheme.
[star] Boost: After this activation, change Apocalypse to [[Giant]] form.

card.name: Source of Power
card.property: When Defeated: If Apocalypse is in [[Biomorph]] form, he activates against the player who defeated this scheme. Otherwise, change Apocalypse to [[Biomorph]] form and give him a tough status card.

card.name: Plugged In
card.property: When Defeated: If Apocalypse is in [[Cyberpath]] form, he activates against the player who defeated this scheme. Otherwise, change Apocalypse to [[Cyberpath]] form and give him a tough status card.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.property: When Defeated: If Apocalypse is in [[Giant]] form, he activates against the player who defeated this scheme. Otherwise, change Apocalypse to [[Giant]] form and give him a tough status card.

card.name: Celestial Armor
card.property: Attach to the villain. [star] Forced Interrupt: When the villain schemes against you, discard the top card of your deck. If that card's resource has: [energy] — Heal 2 damage from the villain. [mental] — You are confused. Discard this card. [physical] — Give the villain a tough status card. [wild] — Do all of the above.

card.name: Celestial Weapon
card.property: Attach to the villain. [star] Forced Interrupt: When the villain attacks you, discard the top card of your deck. If that card's resource has: [energy] — Deal 2 damage to your identity. [mental] — Discard a card from your hand. [physical] — You are stunned. Discard this card. [wild] — Do all of the above.

card.name: Celestial Tech
card.property: When Revealed: For each [[Celestial]] attachment in play, resolve its effect as if the attached villain just schemed against you and attacked you. If there are no [[Celestial]] attachments on the villain, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Celestial]] attachment and reveal it. (Shuffle.)

card.name: Ozymandias
card.property:
Toughness. Villainous. [star] When Ozymandias schemes, place the threat on Ancient Ritual.
[star] Boost: Choose: Either place 3 threat on Ancient Ritual, or this card gains [boost][boost][boost].

card.name: Scarab
card.property: Quickstrike. [star] Forced Response: After Scarab attacks, place 1 threat on Ancient Ritual (3 threat instead if the attack defeated an ally).

card.name: Clan Akkaba Zealot
card.property:
Guard. When Defeated: Place 2 threat on Ancient Ritual.
[star] Boost: Place 1 threat on Ancient Ritual.

card.name: Tyrant Worship
card.property:
When Revealed: Place 5 threat on Ancient Ritual.
[star] Boost: Choose: Either place 3 threat on Ancient Ritual, or this card gains [boost][boost][boost].
Clan Akkaba has dedicated itself completely to its lord's merciless doctrine.

card.name: Ancient Ritual
card.property: Permanent. Setup. Forced Response: After threat is placed here, if there is at least 10 threat here, remove 5 threat from this scheme and deal each player a facedown encounter card.
"Not sure what they're doing, but I'm sure it's not good." —Iceman

card.name: Agent of Apocalypse
card.property:
Guard. When Revealed: Choose: Either add Agent of Apocalypse to the mission area, or it activates against you.
[star] Boost: Deal 1 damage to an ally at the mission. Give the activating enemy an additional boost card.

card.name: Worldwide Crisis
card.property:
When Revealed: Choose: Either place 3 threat on the [[Mission]] side scheme, or take 1 damage and this card gains surge.
[star] Boost: Place 1 threat on the [[Mission]] side scheme. Give the activating enemy an additional boost card.

card.name: Liberate the Seattle Core
card.property: Forced Response: After you resolve a mission attempt, place 1 attempt counter here and deal 1 damage to each ally at the mission. If there are 4 attempt counters here, remove Mission Team from the game and flip this card over. When Defeated: Shuffle each player card at the mission into its owner's deck. Flip Mission Team and this card over.

alternate.name: Liberate the Seattle Core
alternate.property: Forced Response: After you flip to this side, remove each card in the mission area from the game and do the following: • If the mission was not defeated, place 2[per_hero] threat on the main scheme. • If the mission was defeated, each player adds 1 copy of the Desperate Measures upgrade to their hand.

card.name: Evacuate Survivors
card.property: Forced Response: After you resolve a mission attempt, place 1 attempt counter here and deal 1 damage to each ally at the mission. If there are 4 attempt counters here, remove Mission Team from the game and flip this card over. When Defeated: Shuffle each player card at the mission into its owner's deck. Flip Mission Team and this card over.

alternate.name: Evacuate Survivors
alternate.property: Forced Response: After you flip to this side, remove each card in the mission area from the game and do the following: • If the mission was not defeated, deal each player a facedown encounter card. • If the mission was defeated, each player searches their deck and discard pile for 1 card and adds it to their hand.

card.name: Sabotage the Sea Wall
card.property: Forced Response: After you resolve a mission attempt, place 1 attempt counter here and deal 1 damage to each ally at the mission. If there are 4 attempt counters here, remove Mission Team from the game and flip this card over. When Defeated: Shuffle each player card at the mission into its owner's deck. Flip Mission Team and this card over.

alternate.name: Sabotage the Sea Wall
alternate.property: Forced Response: After you flip to this side, remove each card in the mission area from the game and do the following: • If the mission was not defeated, find North American Sea Wall and reveal it. (Shuffle.) • If the mission was defeated, find North American Sea Wall, remove it from the game, and each player deals 3 damage to an enemy.

card.name: Find Lost Mutants
card.property: Forced Response: After you resolve a mission attempt, place 1 attempt counter here and deal 1 damage to each ally at the mission. If there are 4 attempt counters here, remove Mission Team from the game and flip this card over. When Defeated: Shuffle each player card at the mission into its owner's deck. Flip Mission Team and this card over.

alternate.name: Find Lost Mutants
alternate.property: Forced Response: After you flip to this side, remove each card in the mission area from the game and do the following: • If the mission was not defeated, each player discards 1 card from their hand. • If the mission was defeated, each player adds one set-aside campaign ally to their hand.

card.name: Protect the Professor
card.property: Forced Response: After you resolve a mission attempt, place 1 attempt counter here and deal 1 damage to each ally at the mission. If there are 4 attempt counters here, remove Mission Team from the game and flip this card over. When Defeated: Shuffle each player card at the mission into its owner's deck. Flip Mission Team and this card over.

alternate.name: Protect the Professor
alternate.property: Forced Response: After you flip to this side, remove each card in the mission area from the game and do the following: • If the mission was not defeated, the players lose the game. • If the mission was defeated, each player searches their deck and discard pile for an ally and adds it to their hand.

card.name: North American Sea Wall
card.property:
Hinder 2[per_hero]. Surge. Victory 2. The villain cannot take damage.
[star] Boost: Deal this card to yourself as a facedown encounter card.
Apocalypse's high-tech sea wall protects the eastern frontier of his realm.

card.name: Panicked Refugees
card.property: Forced Response: After this card enters your hand, reveal it. Then, draw 1 card. Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust your identity → remove this card from the game.

card.name: Mister Sinister
card.property: Victory 5. Cannot take damage while another minion is at the mission. Players cannot assign cards with the same resource icon ([energy], [mental], [physical], or [wild]) to more than one ally each mission attempt.

alternate.name: Mister Sinister
alternate.property: Retaliate 1. Toughness. Villainous. Victory 3. Mister Sinister engages the first player.

card.name: The Shadow King
card.property: Victory 5. Cannot take damage while another minion is at the mission. Mission Response: After you discard cards, place 2 threat on the [[Mission] side schemes for each mental resource ([mental]) discarded.

alternate.name: The Shadow King
alternate.property: Toughness. Victory 3. Shadow King engages the first player. [star] Forced Response: After The Shadow King attacks you, choose an ally you control with the highest THW. Either discard that ally, or place threat on the main scheme equal to its THW.

alternate.name: Abyss
alternate.property: Toughness. Victory 3. Abyss gets +2 hit points for each facedown card attached to him and engages the first player. [star] Forced Response: After Abyss activates against you, attach the top card of your deck to him, facedown.

card.name: Sugar Man
card.property: Victory 5. Cannot take damage while another minion is at the mission. Mission Response: After you discard cards, heal 3 damage from Sugar Man for each physical resource ([physical]) discarded.

alternate.name: Sugar Man
alternate.property: Toughness. Victory 3. Sugar Man engages the first player. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Sugar Man attacks, this attack gains piercing. If this attack defeats a character, heal 5 damage from Sugar Man.

alternate.name: Mikhail Rasputin
alternate.property: Toughness. Victory 3. Mikhail Rasputin engages the first player. [star] Forced Interrupt: When Mikhail Rasputin attacks you, deal 1 damage to your identity.

card.name: Apocalypse (Biomorph)
card.property: [star] Apocalypse's attacks gain overkill. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, deal 1 indirect damage to each player.
"Now I claim my destiny!"

alternate.name: Apocalypse (Cyberpath)
alternate.property: Retaliate 1. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, place 1 threat on each scheme in play.
"I have judged you and found you wanting."

alternate.name: Apocalypse (Giant)
alternate.property: Stalwart. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, heal 1 damage from him.
"I am as far beyond mutants as they are above humans."

card.name: Apocalypse (Biomorph)
card.property: [star] Apocalypse's attacks gain overkill. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, deal 2 indirect damage to each player.
"Now I claim my destiny!"

alternate.name: Apocalypse (Cyberpath)
alternate.property: Retaliate 1. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, place 2 threat on each scheme in play.
"I have judged you and found you wanting."

alternate.name: Apocalypse (Giant)
alternate.property: Stalwart. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, heal 2 damage from him.
"I am as far beyond mutants as they are above humans."

card.name: Apocalypse (Biomorph)
card.property: [star] Apocalypse's attacks gain overkill. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, deal 3 indirect damage to each player.
"Now I claim my destiny!"

alternate.name: Apocalypse (Cyberpath)
alternate.property: Retaliate 1. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, place 3 threat on each scheme in play.
"I have judged you and found you wanting."

alternate.name: Apocalypse (Giant)
alternate.property: Stalwart. Forced Response: After Apocalypse changes to this form, heal 3 damage from him.
"I am as far beyond mutants as they are above humans."
